title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments:
Hey you guys.. so recently I finished a French show called "Dix pour cent" or "Call My Agent". It's on Netflix and it's pretty cool. The characters have a good development and it's not just focussed on one person, and I like that. So it's a show about a Talent Firm and it's agents, their relationship with actors, writers, producers and how they're trying to keep the firm afloat, while their work lives get mixed with their personal (of course). Camille Cottin acted brilliantly and is being recognised internationally!! She totally deserves it!

They will prolly come up with another season soon, but this was a good ending, they sort of tied up the loose ends, but I can't wait to watch when the new season drops of course.
For Sherlock Holmes fans here, many Sherlock Holmes movies are now colorized and available on you tube.
Watching Psych for the first time! Pretty good show to pass time. Don't know why I never watched it earlier
link please

https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=sherlock+holmes+colorized+movies+

Basil Rathbone movies from 40s are mostly now in colour.
Yup, definitely captivating. I mentioned in the last thread.

Revisited rezero s2 p1, didnt get the same goosebumps I had while watching for the first time but was amazing

The soundtracks, the voice acting and the whole tense atmosphere felt so great

10/10 would recommend people to watch it

So everyone on reddit always said hindi series on television were really bad so I never saw them. I only ever saw English series. 

Recently came across Crime Patrol Satark, its quite good.
'Crime patrol satark ' which is produced by optimystix is good other production companies '  'crime patrol dial 100' etc is bad.
yeah satark and dastak are based on real stories apparently, the others are made up
Ted Lasso ftw

will rewatch "have a good trip" on netflix today

also excited for the upcoming inspiration4 documentary
Watched Undekhi on Sony LIV. Was terrified whole time

Dastak and satrak and specially there old episodes are best. They covered scams roberry and many other type of crime. But after that they become monotonous with episode based on adultery, murder and rape.
Binged The Brink.. Hilarious geo political satire starring Jack Black and Tim Robbins..

Bingeing on Nordic noir. Started with Katla, continued with The Valhalla Murders, planning to see Trapped now.

Any other such tv series or movies that portrays iceland and other nordic countries in its glory?
Bron/Broen
Trapped is good on Netflix
Black Sunday by Mario Bava is the vintage horror movie I've always wanted.
I never realised how tall Tim Robbins is, until I watched that show.

that TV show with Jeremy Brett starring as Sherlock Holmes is a must watch. They stayed true to the novels/stories in that series.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherlock_Holmes_(1984_TV_series)
I only watched one of its episodes because it had Monica Bellucci haha.
Oh hell yes!

Documentary about Goa from France24 TV Channel.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0CtovCZVI6A
Jeremy Brett is the best Holmes I feel, a notch slightly above Basil Rathbone.
You know what, Rebecca is chatting with Ted on the new dating app.
Mentalist is better
Watched it long ago
its an average series and the last 4 episodes were stretched a lot.

Lol I love how this shit is triggering the ted lasso sub- few people are having a meltdown.

But it‚Äôs such a good show 30 minutes of constant smiling while watching is rare for a tv show.

Mystery genre based  tv series and YT channels batao üò§üò§üò§

Lemmino was good
Straight from my heart- great podcast for poetry lovers.

Comparing apples to oranges. Not every deck of cards is uno.

Psych is at times nonsensical and at times meta-humour. Mentalist is a standard procedural, albeit interesting at times. Psych in fact mentions Mentalist multiple times (in a good light lest you get worried).
I remember reading that the show was cancelled. The recent interest sparked talks of a movie though
If you prefer watching another french series, Au service de la France or A very secret service is quite cool.

Oh yes, it was recommended me to and I did start it, and I'm sure it's a good show.. I'm just not in that state of mind to watch it rn. 
But I will restart it soon :))
Ayee spoiler alertt!
Its a great show! I enjoyed it a lot
Binge watching peep show. funniest show I have ever seen.
You gotta check out Reignbot, Nexpo and Nightmind. All youtube channels and they deal with some fun topics
Oi, I am just speculating (In Roy Kent's voice).

Desperate for some tips for south indian or north eastern films. Can't swallow bollywood or most indies without at least some indigestion. My neighbour is from kerela and supposedly an artist but every time I bring this up with him, he just hands me a stack of his mother's appams, I have no idea what that has to do with movies. Somebody help.
Hindi dubbed marathi tv serial 'raat ka hai khel saara ' on zee5

"Bell bottom" is utter dogshit.. Not because I am anti-canadian. 

The film sucks from beginning to end...
Saw Mimi recently! It was good.
Shershaah too..

From this year, check out "The Great Indian Kitchen" (Malayalam). It should be on Amazon Prime Video.

Excerpt from Wikipedia:

*The Great Indian Kitchen is a 2021 Indian Malayalam-language drama film written and directed by Jeo Baby. The film tells the story of a newly wed woman who struggles to be the submissive wife that her husband and his family expect her to be.*

Not sure about the glory part, but check these out on Netflix:

\* Occupied (Norwegian/English/Russian)

\* Borgen (Danish)
Haha. You're welcome üòÑ
I was wrong üòù

Memories of a Murderer: The Nilsen¬†Tapes  
It was alright, quite a grim tale
